page.title: 15HEDDON-ON-THE-WALL.
page.content: It is built near to the{Roman Wall which stretched west from{Newcastle}to {Carlisle.}It is built on a hill and looks over the Tyne Valley. There is a church, a chapel, a Memorial Hall, three public houses and a First School. It is a residential area which looks onto farm land and has a section of the wall excavated so that you can see the shape, size and depth of the wall. It existed before the coming of the Romans in the times of the{Ancient {Britons}as a small hill fort because of its commanding position.
